alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Elmore; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:41AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Autauga, southwestern Elmore, northern Lowndes, east central Dallas and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 441 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Vida Junction to near Mulberry to Tyler. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Prattville, Selma, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Mosses, Hayneville, Selmont-West Selmont, Elmore, Coosada, Autaugaville, White Hall, Lowndesboro, Benton, Booth, Montgomery Zoo, Vida Junction, Boylston, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama and Gardner Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
